The Chapter with Sihāsani
The Elder Raṭṭhapāla’s Birth Story🔽“I gave a fine elephant
to the Fortunate One Padumuttara,

analyzed: vara nāgaḥ mayā dinnaḥ  īsādantaḥ urūḍhavā
translated: the Leader of the World, the One of Great Compassion,🔽with tusks like a ploughshare, and well-grown.
The white parasol was resplendent,🔽with a saddle, and with an elephant goad;
having had it all valued,
I had a monastery made.

analyzed: catu paññāsa sahassāni  pāsāde kārayim aha
translated: I had fifty-four thousand🔽houses made,
and having given a great gift,🔽I dedicated it to the Great Seer.
The Great Hero, the Self-Made One, the Foremost Person,
rejoiced,
and making all the people laugh,
he taught the Deathless State.
The Buddha explained it to me,
(saying) ‘The one called Jalajuttara,
while sitting in the Community of monks,
recited these verses:
‘He had fifty-four thousand
houses made,
I will tell of the outcome,
listen to my words.
There will be eighteen thousand🔽houses,
and they will be reborn in the highest place,
and they will be made entirely of gold.
Fifty times he will be Sakka, the Lord of the Gods,
will rule as king of the gods.
Fifty-eight times
he will be a wheel-turning monarch.
After a hundred thousand aeons,

Later, having gone forth,

analyzed: sukka mūlena coditaḥ  raṭṭhapālo ti nāmena
translated: urged on by the root of merit,🔽he will be a disciple of the Teacher,

analyzed: hessati satthu sāvakaḥ  padhāna pahitattaḥ saḥ
translated: known as Raṭṭhapāla.🔽He will be intent on striving,

Having risen and gone forth,
having abandoned the wealth of possessions,
like a lump of spittle in regard to wealth,
I have no affection.
My energy is the yoke-bearing beast,
the vehicle for attaining safety from bondage;
I bear this last body,
in the Dispensation of the Buddha.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six super-knowledges have been experienced,
the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.”
